_header: Thomas rides from Rome the man that right kens
Note: For the two prophecies generally associated with this piece under the title of the ‘Scottish Prophecies’ see 6398 and 6434.
Subjects: Thomas of Canterbury, saint, miracles of; prophecies, political
_description: Miracles and Prophecies of St. Thomas of Canterbury — in nonrhyming alliterative verse

BodHat56.First Lines:
Thomas rides fro rome þe man þat right kennesHe faris
                    forth by a faire towne Pise it is hotyn…
BodHat56.Last Lines:
…þou gave me litell by our lord laughyng to make hereIt
                    is [ ]w & no tris[ ] þat þis boke tellis
BodHat56.Editions:
Brandl,  Alois Leonhard. 
             “Thomas Beckets Weissagung über Edward III und Heinrich V.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         102 (1899): 352-7: 354-7.
Taylor,  Rupert. 
             The Political Prophecy in England.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1911: 165 (lines 1-30 only).

CULKk15.First Lines:
…Thomas takes the Iuell and Ihesus thankesþat comyne was
                    to hume fro his Ientyll moder…
CULKk15.Last Lines:
…þen the buk was borne vp to þe blysse off our
                    lordeAnd beket to burgone nuskes hume full Evine
CULKk15.Editions:
Stevenson,  Joseph. 
             The Scottish Metrical Romance of Lancelot du Lak.
Maitland Club
         48. Edinburgh, 1839: 135-55.
Lumby,  Joseph Rawson,
                        ed.  
             Bernardus De Cura Rei Famuliaris, with some early Scottish
                Prophecies.
EETS
         o.s. 42 (1870); repr. 1965: 23-31.
